conclusion: Understanding principles of magnetic induction and behavior of charged particles in magnetic fields.
Figure shows two uniform magnetic fields, B1 and B2, with B1 = 2B2.
A particle with a charge +q and a mass m enters the magnetic field B1 perpendicularly to MN at point O.
The particle moves downward through the magnetic field B1.
Time of flight can be calculated using the formula t = L/v.
Distance L can be calculated using the formula L = mv^2/(2B1).
Substituting values into the formula for t: t = m*v^2/(2B1).
The time t that the particle will pass through point O downward again is t = m*v^2/(2B1).
